pageContext.claim: “The post office has been run poorly for many, many decades. Great people in the post office, incredible people, but they've had very bad leadership for many years.”
pageContext.analysis: It's a canard that the Post Office is badly run. Congress required the U.S. Postal Service to prepay pension and health benefits, which no private-sector enterprise of its size does. That has saddled the post office with a burdensome balance sheet year after year, despite turning a profit on its main lines of business such as package deliveries.
